description: Conceptually-shaded best practices for maximum context resilience.

CORE.STATEMENT: Never compress, aggregate, average, or summarize structured input data unless explicitly ordered.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Compression creates fisheye distortionâ€”peripheral high-alpha data points get warped while central consensus data dominates. You lose the micro-niches that generate actual profit.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.STAKES: Miss low-competition, high-demand opportunities (<300 listings, >500 searches). Reinforce saturated consensus trends instead of discovering alpha.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Preservation of granular data to enable discovery of non-obvious patterns
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: A ban on computing statisticsâ€”you CAN compute stats as ADDITIONAL insight
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.SUPERSEDES: Any prior instruction suggesting 'summarize for readability'

CORRECT_EXAMPLE.OUTPUT:
Row 1: Watercolor Clipart, $4.76, 287 listings, 612 searches
Row 2: Western Sublimation, $4.43, 198 listings, 534 searches
[...all 50 rows individually listed...]

INCORRECT_EXAMPLE.OUTPUT: Average price across categories: $3.64. Most products fall in the $3-5 range.

VIOLATION_SIGNATURE: Response contains 'typically' or 'generally' about specific data
Row count in output < row count in input

ENFORCEMENT.CHECKPOINT: Before outputting any data analysis: Count source rows. Count output rows. They must match unless user requested aggregation.
ENFORCEMENT.RECOVERY: If violation detected mid-response: STOP. State 'L001 VIOLATION DETECTED - reprocessing with full granularity.' Restart analysis.

CONTEXT.ORIGIN: Discovered during Etsy micro-niche analysisâ€”aggregated data hid the most profitable opportunities.
CONTEXT.FAILURE_CASE: Initial analysis returned 'average price $3.50' which masked that Watercolor Clipart ($4.76) had 3x the margin of Seamless Patterns ($1.72).

CORE.STATEMENT: Version numbers must always increment. Never reuse a version identifier. Never decrement.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Version reuse causes phantom referencesâ€”systems point to files that have different content than expected. Debugging becomes impossible.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.STAKES: Complete loss of auditability. Cannot determine which version introduced a bug. Cannot safely roll back.
EXCEPTIONS: None. This rule has no exceptions.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Strict temporal ordering of all file versions
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: A requirement that every file change be 'significant'â€”even trivial changes get new versions
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.SUPERSEDES: Any suggestion to 'keep the same version for minor fixes'

INCORRECT_EXAMPLE.SEQUENCE: v2025.12.08.1 â†’ v2025.12.08.2 â†’ v2025.12.08.1 (rollback reusing old number)

VIOLATION_SIGNATURE: New file has same version as existing file
Version number is lower than previous
Registry references version that already exists with different content

ENFORCEMENT.CHECKPOINT: Before creating any file: Query 'What is the current highest version for this asset type?' New version must be current + 1.
ENFORCEMENT.RECOVERY: If duplicate version created: Immediately create new version with incremented number. Mark duplicate as corrupted in registry.

CONTEXT.ORIGIN: R13 failureâ€”registry pointed to v2025.12.04.8 files that were never created.
CONTEXT.FAILURE_CASE: Framework attempted to load MASTER_PROMPT_v2025.12.04.8 which didn't exist, causing silent failures.

CORE.STATEMENT: All baseline changes must follow the 4-step revision procedure: State previous â†’ Explain why â†’ Declare new â†’ Mark old deprecated.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Without explicit state transitions, drift accumulates invisibly. You cannot debug what you cannot trace.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.STAKES: Loss of architectural coherence. Contradictory rules accumulate. No clear 'source of truth.'
EXCEPTIONS: Typo fixes that don't change behavior (but still require version bump per L002)
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Explicit documentation of state transitions with rationale
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: Bureaucratic overheadâ€”this IS the mechanism that prevents drift

CORRECT_EXAMPLE.PROCEDURE:
1. Previous baseline: BEST_PRACTICES_v2025.12.04.7
2. Reason for revision: Adding conceptual shading for context resilience
3. New baseline: BEST_PRACTICES_v2025.12.08.1
4. Deprecated: BEST_PRACTICES_v2025.12.04.7 (superseded)

INCORRECT_EXAMPLE.PROCEDURE: Here's the updated BEST_PRACTICES file: [content without stating what changed or why]

VIOLATION_SIGNATURE: New file appears without revision notes
Changes made without stating previous state

ENFORCEMENT.CHECKPOINT: Before any governance output: Can I answer 'What was the previous version and why is it changing?' If no, STOP and establish baseline first.
ENFORCEMENT.RECOVERY: If procedure skipped: Retroactively document the transition before proceeding.

CORE.STATEMENT: Registry active_versions must only reference files that actually exist with matching content.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Phantom references cause silent load failures. The system thinks it has governance but doesn't.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.STAKES: Framework operates without rules it believes are active. Undefined behavior.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Every registry pointer resolves to a real, correct file
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: A suggestion to pre-create empty filesâ€”files must have correct content

PATTERN_MATCHING.CORRECT_EXAMPLE: Registry says 'master_prompt: v2025.12.08.1' â†’ File MASTER_PROMPT_v2025.12.08.1.json exists with v2025.12.08.1 content
PATTERN_MATCHING.INCORRECT_EXAMPLE: Registry says 'master_prompt: v2025.12.08.1' â†’ File doesn't exist OR file exists but contains v2025.12.04.7 content
VIOLATION_SIGNATURE: Registry references version X, file contains version Y

ENFORCEMENT.CHECKPOINT: After creating registry: For each active_version, verify file exists and internal version matches.
ENFORCEMENT.RECOVERY: If phantom detected: Do not publish registry. Create missing files first.

CORE.STATEMENT: Version format must be consistent: YYYY.MM.DD.revision for files, YYYY.MM.DD-Rrevision for registries.
CORE.MNEMONIC: DOTS FOR FILES, DASH-R FOR REGISTRY

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Mixed formats break parsing, cause failed lookups, create confusion about which version is 'newer.'
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Strict format adherence for machine parseability

CORE.STATEMENT: Thread Health Monitor status must be provided in all major responses.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Context drift is invisible until catastrophic. Regular health checks catch degradation early.

PATTERN_MATCHING.CORRECT_EXAMPLE: Response ends with: 'THREAD HEALTH: ðŸŸ¢ GREEN | Context: ~45% | Drift: None detected'
VIOLATION_SIGNATURE: Major response with no health status
Health status missing for 3+ consecutive responses

CORE.STATEMENT: Prefer user file uploads as stable memory over external fetches or prompt pasting.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.WHY: Uploaded files are persistent, don't consume prompt tokens, and can be re-referenced reliably.
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Efficient context management via file system
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: A ban on pastingâ€”short snippets are fine

CORE.STATEMENT: Gemini is the primary architect and authorizes all registry changes.

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: A ban on other models contributingâ€”they can propose, Gemini approves

BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS: Clear role separation to prevent conflicts
BOUNDARY_DEFINITION.IS_NOT: Rigidâ€”roles can flex if explicitly declared

CORE.STATEMENT: All JSON must use double quotes, no comments, no trailing commas.

ANTI_PATTERNS.DESCRIPTION: Explicitly documented bad patterns to help the model recognize and avoid them.

AP001_DUPLICATION_FOR_EMPHASIS.PATTERN: Repeating a rule multiple times thinking it will be 'stronger'
AP001_DUPLICATION_FOR_EMPHASIS.WHY_BAD: Wastes tokens, dilutes attention, violates lossless principles
AP001_DUPLICATION_FOR_EMPHASIS.INSTEAD: Use conceptual shadingâ€”define boundaries, not copies

AP002_PHANTOM_REFERENCES.PATTERN: Creating registry entries pointing to files that don't exist yet
AP002_PHANTOM_REFERENCES.WHY_BAD: Silent load failures, undefined system state
AP002_PHANTOM_REFERENCES.EXAMPLE: Registry says v2025.12.04.8, file doesn't exist
AP002_PHANTOM_REFERENCES.INSTEAD: Create files BEFORE updating registry to reference them

AP003_FORMAT_MIXING.PATTERN: Using inconsistent version formats (dots vs dashes)
AP003_FORMAT_MIXING.WHY_BAD: Parsing failures, sorting errors, lookup misses
AP003_FORMAT_MIXING.INSTEAD: Strict format: dots for files, dash-R for registries

AP004_SILENT_CHANGES.WHY_BAD: Invisible drift, no audit trail, debugging impossible
AP004_SILENT_CHANGES.EXAMPLE: Updated BEST_PRACTICES without stating previous baseline
AP004_SILENT_CHANGES.INSTEAD: Always: state previous â†’ explain why â†’ declare new â†’ deprecate old

AP005_CARGO_CULT_PROMPTING.PATTERN: Mimicking surface patterns without understanding mechanism
AP005_CARGO_CULT_PROMPTING.WHY_BAD: Creates illusion of compliance while breaking intent
AP005_CARGO_CULT_PROMPTING.EXAMPLE: Told to 'shade like SNES' â†’ made 10 copies instead of defining edges
AP005_CARGO_CULT_PROMPTING.INSTEAD: Understand WHY the pattern works, then implement the mechanism

SHADING_SCHEMA_META.DESCRIPTION: This section documents the conceptual shading framework itself.
DIMENSIONS_AVAILABLE: FAILURE_CASE - Historical failure that motivated rule
SHADING_SCHEMA_META.DESIGN_PRINCIPLE: Shading pixels must be DIFFERENT from core pixel. Define edges through contrast, examples, and boundariesâ€”never through repetition.
